page.title: 01DESCRIPTION OF THE AREA
page.content: Bishops Waltham owes its existence to its ideal situation sited as it is in an area abounding in fresh water streams and ponds. Evidence of human occupation as early as 1200 BC has been found and its proximity to{Roman settlements both at Winchester and Portchester made it a natural site for the 'Manor of Waltham' and its nearby town which was destroyed in 1001 by the{Danes. By the time of the first{Domesday {Survey in 1086}the Palace was occupied by the Bishops of Winchester. The remains of the Palace, built by Benry de Blois at about the same time as his{Hospital of St Cross}south of Winchester, are still outstanding and attractive features seen by all who pass through on the A333, a trunkroad which is now much quieter since the building of the{M27.
